definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: There is the problem of finding a mate, and fighting off rivals.
sentences.chinese: 要命的是得花力气寻找配偶，还要击退情敌。

sentences.english: When I love you when I see who are like.
sentences.chinese: 当我喜欢你的时候，我看谁都像情敌。

sentences.english: Is likewise, son-in-law ugg short age father-in-law were originally antagonistic in loves.
sentences.chinese: 也是，女婿和老丈人本来就是情敌。

sentences.english: Hera became so greeneyed that she flew down from Olympus one day to pay her rival  back .
sentences.chinese: 一天她飞下奥林波斯山向情敌施加报复。

sentences.english: Your enemy is sleeping, and his woman is free.
sentences.chinese: 那你的情敌会安然入睡，而他的女人已然自由。

definition: to rob sb of sth they cherish (idiom)
mistress/the other woman (coll.)/grade 3 in elementary school
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
vinegar jar/(fig.) person of a jealous nature
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
lit. green plums and hobby-horse (idiom)/fig. innocent children's games/childhood sweethearts/a couple who grew up as childhood friends
